adverbs.description: negatively (comparative more negatively, superlative most negatively)

entries.meaning: In a negative manner; so as to be damaging or not positive.
examples: How justly then might human law and Philosophy rise up against the righteousnesse of Moses, if this be true which our vulgar Divinity Fathers upon him, yeah upon God himselfe; not silently and only negatively to permit, but in his law to divulge a written and generall priviledge to commit and persist in unlawfull divorces with a high hand, with security and no ill fame  […]

entries.meaning: (responding to a question, proposal, vote, etc.) In the negative; with the answer “no.”
